title: QQT - Rotation - Steel Rod on Wood Surface

content.description:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

In Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, one end of a uniform steel rod of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"> <mi>M</mi> </math> and length <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> sits on a horizontal wood surface. The rod can rotate on the surface about an axle that passes through one end of the rod. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the rod and the wood surface is <math alttext="mu sub W" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi></msub></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the rod is rotating about the pivot with initial angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown in the Perspective View. The friction between the rod and the wood surface causes the angular speed of the rod decrease over time until the rod stops at time <math alttext="t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
